author: Dave Burke For Mailonline
title: French police are training EAGLES to attack ISIS drones | Daily Mail Online
text: Share this article Share Experts believe training eagles to deal with threatening drones is far safer than using bullets to shoot them down. Air force general Jean-Christophe Zimmerman told Reuters: 'These eagles can spot the drones several thousand metres away and neutralize them.' He said the idea came from police trials in the Netherlands. The birds are being trained to grab or halt the drones. Before they hatched, they were placed on top of drones before being kept there during their early feeding period. French authorities are concerned that drones are a 'credible' threat as they could be used by terrorists to kill civilians Impressive: An eagle catches hold of a drone in a training exercise amid fears terror groups could use explosive-laden devices Drones have been branded a 'credible threat' by security experts in France, and prompted alarm when they were flown over the Elysée Palace and other Paris landmarks two years ago. A military source told The Telegraph : 'We taught them to feed off the ‘carcasses’ of the drones. 'Now, when they see one of these craft, they think it has food coming off it and they intercept it. We’re teaching them not just to attack but to detect them.' Eagles have a grip 10 times more powerful than a human, making them ideal to deal with large unmanned drones.
